Okura

Wordpress Development + Visual Design

Overview

Okura is a clothing store located in Tokyo, specializing in traditional Japanese tailoring and color dyeing practices. I was drawn to this store by the quality of the clothing and it's unique style stood out from today's fashion trends. I visited their site and was surprised by the lack of intuitiveess in their website. Time for a redesign! My design instincts kicked in and I wanted to teach myself to how to build a Woocommerce site. Let the fun begin!

Goal

Design an app that helps build momentum in a learners profession of interest? I believe the best form of learning comes from within a persons desires and curiosity for a subject. The app is designed to promote that curiosity through self discovery.

Affinity Diagram and Card Sort

The theme of solving a problem in "Education" was the starting point of discovery. As ideas and words around "Education" surfaced, I was able to start putting these island of ideas into logical groupings.

Ideas begin to crystallize. Identifying possible target audiences, features, technology solutions and just as important are the red flags. In this case, "accreditation" was a major sticking point that needed to be considered.

Paper Prototyping

User Testing

Feedback

Here are some captured feedback and responses .

Feedback Response
I don't want to be pressured into commiting to a goal. Auto-save, Remove commitment button
Is there an option to have more than 1 area of interest? Have multiple tasks-list
Is there a way for users to be accredited? Not a platform for accreditation. Self-guided learning is the primary model.
How is the learner task list generated? Manually, suggested by other users, recommendations
Is there any incentives to complete a task? gamification, awards, sponsored tasks

Wire Flow

Logo Design

Hifi Prototype

What I Learned

User testing helped shape the design and flow of the app. Sometimes, eagerness and time crunches gave me the urge to jump right into high fidelity mockups before the design was flushed out on paper. Is it a bad thing? I found that it can be done at the same time and sometimes it can even save you time. Using UI kits can be more of a headache if UI elements influence your design decisions and layout.
